explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_liquids.rationale: Based on its closed cup flash point is 88degC (IUCLID, 2000), the substance was classified into Category 4.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups present in the molecule associated with explosive or self-reactive properties.

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Its autoignition point is >= 300degC (IUCLID, 2000). According to the classification guidelines, a substance with its autoignition point being >= 70degC is classified into the "Not classified" category.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine or chlorine

organic_peroxides.rationale: Organic compounds containing no bivalent -O-O- structure in the molecule

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: It is rated as UNRTDG Class 8 (UNRTDG rev. 15, 2007). Since no further information available, classification is not possible.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Between two rat LD50 values reported: 1470 mg/kg bw and approx. 2140 mg/kg bw (IUCLID, 2000), the lower value was adopted to classify the substance into Category 4.

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Since its rabbit LD50 is 880 mg/kg bw (IUCLID, 2000) and it is rated as R21 in the EU classification (which is equivalent to Category 3 or 4) (EU-Annex 1, accessed in November, 2008), the substance was classified into Category 3.

skin_corrosion_irritation.hazard_statement: Causes severe skin burns and eye damage
skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: In Draize tests using rabbits, the substance was reported to be corrosive and caused skin necrosis as a result of a 24-hour exposure (IUCLID, 2000). Furthermore, it is rated as R34 in the EU classification (EU-Annex 1, accessed in November 2008). Based on this information, the substance was classified into Category 1. According to HSDB (2002), it has human health effects such as strong irritations to the skin, eyes, and respiratory system.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Since it is a skin corrosive substance, it was classified into Category 1. According to HSDB (2002), it has human health effects such as skin, eye, and respiratory irritations.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: In guinea pig maximization tests (OECD test guidelines 406, non-GLP), 15 out of 15 (100%) animals treated with this substance exhibited sensitization reaction (IUCLID, 2000). In addition, it is rated as R43 in the EU classification (EU-Annex 1, accessed in November, 2008). Thus, the substance was classified into Category 1.

carcinogenicity.rationale: The substance was classified into the "Classification not possible" category due to lack of in vivo test results. Regarding in vitro mutagenicity tests, the following tests gave negative results: Ames tests (OECD test guidelines 471, GLP), chromosomal aberration tests using cultured human lymphocytes (OECD test guidelines 473, GLP), HGPRT assays using Chinese hamster V79 cells (OECD test guidelines 476, GLP), and mouse lymphoma assays (OECD test guidelines 476, GLP) (IUCLID, 2000).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: In reproduction toxicity tests using rats, effects on spermatogenesis was noted (IUCLID, 2000). However, details in the study or developmental toxicity of the substance to the offspring are not reported. As such, the substance was classified into the "Classification not possible" category.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: According to HSDB (2002), it has human health effects such as skin, eye, and respiratory irritations. Although the substance also may cause respiratory irritation, no detailed information or test results is available. As such, the substance was classified into the "Classification not possible" category.

aspiration_hazard.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since its 48-hour EC50 = 32 mg/L for crustaceans (Daphnia magna) (IUCLID, 2000), the substance was classified into Category 3.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Harmful to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since its classification for acute toxicity is Category 3, and it is not rapidly degradable (non-biodegradable, BOD degradability: 0% (Biodegradation and Bioconcentration of Existing Chemical Substances under the Chemical Substances Control Law, 2004), the substance was classified into Category 3.
